abs: : This paper deals with work done to solve a practical problem occurring at the Danish Ministry of Education. Here the decision makers require the computation of several solutions to the same problem, each solution is to be optimized considering a single aggregated criteria function. The solutions must be mutual different considering two measures of difference. The paper presents a method for combining the aim for optimization with the aim for diversity using the idea of fitness sharing known from genetic algorithms, eventually yielding a single objective function for a set of solutions. The resulting problems are solved by simulated annealing and, for comparison reasons, also by some ascent heuristics. The software is now on the third year being used by the ministry on a national scale. Keywords: Decision Support; Vector Optimization; Simulated Annealing 1.
